about.summary: An outcome-oriented Operations & Digital Transformation Manager with over 16 years of experience, specializing in enterprise service delivery, client relationship management, and business process transformation. Adept at building scalable systems and managing cross-functional teams, I drive efficiency through digital workflows, automation, and data-informed innovation. Currently leveraging expertise in AI, cybersecurity, and enterprise cloud technologies to deliver high-impact solutions for diverse clients, including SMEs and First Nation organizations.

certificates.name: Introduction to Generative AI Learning Path

projects.name: AIOS Framework (AI-Orchestrated Solutions)
projects.description: A modular, agent-ready framework designed to rapidly deploy AI-driven business solutions for Perth-based SMEs, focusing on local data privacy, low-cost open-source tooling, and cross-agent orchestration. Integrates intelligent workflows across chatbots, RAG pipelines, automation tools, and local LLMs for sustainable, owner-controlled AI deployment.
highlights: Developed an Agentic Automation Engine leveraging local and cloud LLMs with shared memory (OpenMemory + MCP) to execute end-to-end workflows (chatbots, form processing, content creation).
Designed a flexible model architecture supporting local quantized models (Qwen, DeepSeek, Gemma 3n) and cloud-hosted agents (Gemini, Claude, ChatGPT, Ninja AI).
Implemented a multi-agent ready, plug-and-play structure with ports for CrewAI, LangGraph, Flowise, AutoGPT, and Notion/GDocs automation tools.
Integrated Persona Routing and a Prompt Library for dynamic persona selection and context-aware prompt chaining.
Architected for Data Sovereignty Compliance, incorporating First Nation data governance protocols (OCAP, CARE) and supporting offline deployment with containerized training pipelines.

projects.name: AI Chatbot for First Nation Catering Company
projects.description: Led the design and training of a domain-specific AI chatbot for a First Nation catering company in Perth, utilizing lightweight open-source models with privacy-conscious fine-tuning and custom retrieval strategies.
highlights: Led the design and training of a domain-specific AI chatbot for a First Nation catering company, reducing manual customer service workload by 50%.
Utilized lightweight open-source models (Gemma 3n) with privacy-conscious fine-tuning via Unsloth and custom Chain-of-Density (CoD) chunking strategy for optimized retrieval.
Delivered a culturally-aware assistant capable of processing over 300 menu items and company policies, with a scalable embedding architecture ready for RAG.
Created a repeatable chatbot template for other WA-based SMEs.

projects.name: AI Strategy Portfolio & Branding (KTG.one)
projects.description: Built and launched KTG.one as a hybrid AI consultancy and personal portfolio hub, developing content pipelines and integrating agentic workflows for client acquisition.
highlights: Built and launched KTG.one as a hybrid AI consultancy and personal portfolio hub, securing 3 inbound leads pre-launch.
Developed robust content pipelines for blog and YouTube launches, integrating agentic workflows using Gemini Pro.
Built SEO-optimized landing pages for multiple AI tools, including local models, automation services, and education initiatives.

projects.name: First Nation AI Education Initiative
projects.description: Co-researched and drafted a multi-tiered framework for an AI-powered, culturally-aligned educational tool designed for Indigenous children in remote Western Australia, emphasizing governance and privacy.
highlights: Co-researched and drafted a multi-tiered framework for an AI-powered, culturally-aligned educational tool for Indigenous children in remote WA.
Mapped out governance structures, privacy-safe CV sensors, and offline-first deployment strategies with community co-design at the core.
Positioned the initiative for potential fellowship funding via Curtin University’s “Healthy Digital Child” initiative.

projects.name: Global AI Projects Portal
projects.description: Strategic architecture and prompt library engineering for a global roadmap system powered by open-source AI agents, designed to tackle major planetary issues and facilitate collaborative research.
highlights: Initiated the design of a global roadmap system powered by open-source AI agents to address major planetary issues (e.g., world hunger, education, emergency response).
Consolidated prompt knowledge and began building agent workflows using AutoGPT with Kaggle datasets for prototyping.
Actively collaborating with researchers (e.g., Dr. Mike Nzikou) on First Nation and remote learning applications.
